fields.description: I have 4-5 instances running across 2 AZs. It appears the graph only display the healthy/unhealthy instances in one AZ.
fields.summary: ELB: healthy/unhealthy host count is not accurate in monitoring graph

comments.body: Actually the issue seems to be with backend. The 'average' dimension should show the correct sum, but when using euwatch tool, 'sum' dimension show the correct value.

[root@e-04 console]# euwatch-get-stats -n AWS/ELB --dimensions "AvailabilityZone=one,LoadBalancerName=sparklb01" -s Average --period 600 --start-time "2015-08-24T23:00:00Z" --end-time "2015-08-25T00:00:00Z" HealthyHostCount
2015-08-24 23:00:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:10:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:20:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:30:00		1.6				Count
2015-08-24 23:40:00		2.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:50:00		2.0				Count
[root@e-04 console]# 
[root@e-04 console]# 
[root@e-04 console]# euwatch-get-stats -n AWS/ELB --dimensions "AvailabilityZone=two,LoadBalancerName=sparklb01" -s Average --period 600 --start-time "2015-08-24T23:00:00Z" --end-time "2015-08-25T00:00:00Z" HealthyHostCount
2015-08-24 23:00:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:10:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:20:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:30:00		1.3				Count
2015-08-24 23:40:00		2.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:50:00		2.0				Count
[root@e-04 console]# euwatch-get-stats -n AWS/ELB --dimensions "LoadBalancerName=sparklb01" -s Average --period 600 --start-time "2015-08-24T23:00:00Z" --end-time "2015-08-25T00:00:00Z" HealthyHostCount
2015-08-24 23:00:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:10:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:20:00		1.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:30:00		1.45				Count
2015-08-24 23:40:00		2.0				Count
2015-08-24 23:50:00		2.0				Count

Per AWS, it appears when cross-zone LB is enabled, the average should combine hosts across all AZs.

"The number of healthy instances in each Availability Zone. An instance is considered healthy if it meets the healthy threshold configured for the health checks. If cross-zone load balancing is enabled, the number of healthy instances is calculated across all Availability Zones."

I will reverse my previous comments and I think it should be fixed in the console.
Healthy and Unhealthy host count are supposed to be used with availability zone. So either the graphs should contain multiple lines per AZ or should do sum over all numbers per AZs.
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/elb-cloudwatch-metrics.html
Graphs should show one line per AZ, please. Sync with me on colors.

[~jloza]: This one's almost ready for UX review, but I need to know what line colors we should use for multi-line charts.  I set some default colors visible in the elb-chart-line-colors.png screenshot above.  Lemme know if you want those changes, or If you want to tweak those feel free to modify the CHART_COLORS mapping in file eucaconsole/views/cloudwatchapi.py in the GUI-1956 branch

PR at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1582

[~jloza]: Feel free to test this with the 'kg-elb3' load balancer in the US West (Oregon) region.  Also note that some of the display issues w.r.t. the "no data message" notice are tracked/fixed in GUI-2031 (linked as a related ticket), which is in progress.
UX review passed, ready for code review!

One thing is a little funny. In the large chart, the 2nd one you load will show blank while loading, but you can still get hover data from the old chart while mousing over the blank area. [~jloza], a concern?

2nd thing. Not sure how to solve it, but when 2 lines share the same space, there is no way to know where the hidden one is unless you mouse over the graph. That may be acceptable, but wanted to point it out.
Yeah, that's no good. Please kick back to [~kgill] for fixing!
Opened GUI-2044 to address lingering tooltip issue.

I was able to run instances in 2 zones and see both represented in the healthy/unhealthy graphs
